questions: How did air pollution become a nuisance for the Londoners. What steps were taken to solve the problem ?  Or 		State any three steps taken to clean up London.  Or 		Describe various steps which were taken to clean up London.
answers: Large quantities of refuge and waste products polluted air and water.  Widespread use of coal in homes and industries in 19th century England raised serious problems. questions: Explain any three reasons for the increasing concern for the London poor during the nineteenth century.
answers: The poor and filthy living conditions of one room houses which posed a serious threat to public health.  There was danger of fire hazards.  There was also a fear of social disorder or rebellion by the workers especially after the Russian Revolution in 1917.

questions: How was the family life transformed in the industrial city during the 18th century.
answers: ‘Family’ as an institution underwent a social change due to industrialization.  Ties between members of household were loosened and the institution of marriage tended to break down among the working class families.  Women lost their jobs due to machines.  Rich upper class women lived easier lives as they were served by domestic maids who made their work easier.

questions: How did London become a powerful magnet for the migrant population ? Explain.
answers: London became a powerful magnet for migrant population since it offered employment opportunities.  London dockyard housed a large number of porters, traders and people in the shipping line.  Major industries as clothing, footwear, metal, engineering, etc., attracted labour from outside.  Being capital city also, it attracted people.

questions: What was the impact of industrialization and urbanization on the family in Britain in the nineteenth century ?
answers: Women gradually lost their industrial jobs and were forced to work within households.  Through the activities of tailoring, washing or match-box making they could increase their income.  Large number of children were pushed into low paid work.

questions: Explain any three efforts made by women in London to increase their income during eighteenth century. 			  WORK, LIFE AND LEISURE
answers: In the late eighteenth century, large numbers of women were employed in factories.  They were working as maid servants .  A large number of women used their homes to increase family income by taking in lodgers or through such activities as tailoring, washing or match-box making.

questions: When was the London underground railway started ? How did it help to solve the housing problem ?
answers: The very first section of the underground railway in London started on 10th January, 1863.
